SEARCH
Package org.eso.ias.plugin.filter

Class FilterBase

java.lang.Object
org.eso.ias.plugin.filter.FilterBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
Filter
Direct Known Subclasses:
AverageBySamples, AverageByTime, NoneFilter
public abstract class FilterBase extends Object implements Filter
The basic class for the filters.

FilterBase keeps a time ordered history of samples: newest items are in the head of the list.

Implementation of filters must take care of removing elements from the history when a new element is added (sampleAdded(org.eso.ias.plugin.filter.Filter.EnrichedSample)) and/or when the filtered value is retrieved Filter.apply().

Objects of this class stores also:

  • the point in time when the last sample had been submitted (lastSampleSubmssionTime
  • the last filtered value returned applying the filter lastReturnedValue

The filtering is not supposed to perform any I/O but to perform the calculation only on the samples in the history.

Author:
acaproni

    • lastSampleSubmssionTime

      protected Optional<Long> lastSampleSubmssionTime

    • sampleAdded

      protected abstract void sampleAdded(Filter.EnrichedSample newSample)
      sampleAdded is executed after adding the sample to the history to let the implementation of a filter does any computation it might need.
      Parameters:
      newSample - The sample to add

    • applyFilter

      protected abstract Optional<FilteredValue> applyFilter()
      apply() calls this method of the filter to get the filtered value and return to the caller.
      Returns:
      the filtered value

    • apply

      public final Optional<FilteredValue> apply()
      Apply the filter to the samples in the history and return the filtered value or empty if there are no samples in the history.

      The calculation of the filter is delegated to applyFilter().

      Specified by:
      apply in interface Filter
      Returns:
      The value after applying the filter

    • newSample

      public final Optional<FilteredValue> newSample(Filter.EnrichedSample newSample) throws FilterException
      Acquire a new sample.

      The new sample is added at the head.

      Specified by:
      newSample in interface Filter
      Parameters:
      newSample - The new sample to add
      Returns:
      The filtered values after adding the new sample
      Throws:
      FilterException - If the sample is not timely ordered

    • removeOldSamples

      protected int removeOldSamples(long time, TimeUnit unit)
      Remove from the history the samples older then the passed time
      Parameters:
      time - The time to remove samples
      unit - the time unit of the time argument
      Returns:
      The number of removed samples

    • removeLastSamples

      protected int removeLastSamples(int nSamples)
      Remove the last nSamples from the history.

      The removal proceed from the tail that contains the oldest samples.

      Parameters:
      nSamples - The number of samples to remove
      Returns:
      The number of removed samples

    • keepNewest

      protected int keepNewest(int nSamples)
      Remove the last nSamples from the history until it contains only nSamples samples.
      Parameters:
      nSamples - The number of samples to keep in the history
      Returns:
      The number of removed samples

    • historySnapshot

      protected List<Filter.EnrichedSample> historySnapshot()
      historySnapshot returns a snapshot of the actual history that is part of the FilteredValue returned by apply().

      The collection is a read-only view of a copy of the .history

      Returns:
      a read-only snapshot of the actual history

    • peekNewest

      protected Optional<Filter.EnrichedSample> peekNewest()
      Retrieves, but does not remove, the newest sample in the history, or returns empty if the history is empty.
      Returns:
      the newest element of the history, or empty if the history is empty

      protected int getHistorySize()
      Returns:
      the size of the history

      Returns:
